intro: Argyrochosma flava, commonly known as the yellow stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, and the stems are often covered in a waxy coating. Argyrochosma flava thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments.
